sentences.en: Every time I sing that line, I have to compete with that bloody trombone!
sentences.cn: 每次唱到那一句，我都不得不跟那该死的长号拼声音。

sentences.en: In this style of music , the trumpet , clarinet , and trombone form the basis of instrumentation.
sentences.cn: 这种新乐风演奏的基本乐器包括喇叭, 黑管和伸缩喇叭.

sentences.en: Not bad considering what I did to that poor trombone!
sentences.cn: 看来那次把伸缩喇叭砸坏也不是什么坏事.

sentences.en: The trombone is an essential musical instrument for a symphony orchestra.
sentences.cn: 拉管是交响乐队不可缺少的乐器之一.

sentences.en: There are some wonderful trumpet and trombone solos in the piece.
sentences.cn: 这支乐曲中有一些美妙的小号和长号的独奏.

sentences.en: Up in the stands , off by himself , he was playing the trombone - playing his head off.
sentences.cn: 他独自一人在台上,卖力地演奏长号.

trans.tran_en: a large metal musical instrument that you play by blowing into it and sliding a long tube in and out to change the notes
